# finalize()

**Instance Method**

Finalizes the hash function and returns the computed digest.

## Declaration

```swift
func finalize() -> SHA512.Digest
```

## Return Value

The computed digest of the data.

## Discussion

Call this method after you provide the hash function with all the data to hash by making one or more calls to the `update(data:)` or [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SHA512/update(bufferPointer:)] method. After finalizing the hash function, discard it. To compute a new digest, create a new hash function with a call to the [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SHA512/init()] method.

## Computing a hash iteratively

- **init()**: Creates a SHA512 hash function.
- **update(bufferPointer:)**: Incrementally updates the hash function with the contents of the buffer.

items.description: Incrementally updates the hash function with the contents of the buffer.
